result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Bladimir Ramos Diaz
Current: 515 W. Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 10-07-2022)
Prior: 1627 S West Ave,#3, Waukesha, WI 53189

9:26 AM Defendant Bladimir Ramos Diaz in court, in custody.  Attorney Erik I. Colque Aty in court for Bladimir Ramos Diaz.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Molly Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Dawn Maldonado appeared in person as interpreter and sworn in.
Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Adjustment Number: 22A 037641,
Payable Number: 476332,
Receipt Number: 22R 041380,
Amount: $20.00
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on September 30, 2022.
protective order with victim key attached

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to have no contact with victims listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release. Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victims, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent. Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court. Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) prior to being released from custody/within 24 hours of release from custody.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance,  duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action. Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with any child including contact.  Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victims listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. Defendant is prohibited from accessing any child exploitation material and any other sexually explicit material through the Internet or by any other means.  Defendant prohibited from contacting a minor over the internet or using a website to gather information about a minor. Defendant is prohibited from intentionally deleting any history from any computer or device that accesses the Internet. Defendant prohibited from using any application where the content automatically deletes upon the recipient opening the content.

3:37 PM Defendant Bladimir Ramos Diaz in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Bladimir Ramos Diaz. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  Dawn Maldonado appeared by Zoom as interpreter previously sworn.  
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court finds no victims are present.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
